intro: Bulbostylis pluricephala, commonly known as the many-headed bulblet sedge, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale green flowers that bloom in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of ponds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying wetland ecosystems.
